摘要： 嵌套 | 字段 | 构造方法 | 方法 详细信息： 字段 | 构造方法 | 方法

com.lqk.framework.verification
类 Rules

java.lang.Object
  com.lqk.framework.verification.Rules

public final class Rules
extends java.lang.Object

A built-in class with a collection of common rules. TextView references notable direct and indirect subclasses that includes but not limited to EditText, AutoCompleteTextView, ExtractEditText and MultiAutoCompleteTextView. Checkable references notable implementing classes but not limited to CheckBox, CheckedTextView, RadioButton and ToggleButton. You may use it with any custom Views you may define that extends or implements the above mentioned classes and interfaces.

作者：
Ragunath Jawahar

构造方法详细信息

Rules

public Rules()
方法详细信息

required

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> required(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                     boolean trimInput)
The classical required Rule. Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text is not empty.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
trimInput - Specifies whether to trim the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the View is not empty, false otherwise. The return value is affected by the trimInput parameter.

regex

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> regex(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                  java.lang.String regex,
                                                  boolean trimInput)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text matches the given regular expression.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
regex - Regular expression pattern to be matched against the text returned by getText().
trimInput - Specifies whether to trim the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the text matches the regular expression. The return value is affected by the trimInput parameter.
抛出：
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If regex is null.

minLength

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> minLength(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                      int minLength,
                                                      boolean trimInput)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text has at least the minimum number of characters specified by this Rule.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
minLength - Minimum number of characters required in the text returned by getText(). The returned text is affected by the trimInput parameter.
trimInput - Specifies whether to trim the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the text has the minimum number of characters specified, false otherwise.

maxLength

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> maxLength(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                      int maxLength,
                                                      boolean trimInput)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text's length is less than or equal to the maximum number of characters specified by this Rule.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
maxLength - Maximum number of characters allowed in the text returned by getText(). The returned text is affected by the trimInput parameter.
trimInput - Specifies whether to trim the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the text length is less than or equal to the maximum number of characters specified, false otherwise.

eq

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> eq(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                               android.widget.TextView anotherTextView)
Checks if the contents of two TextViews are equal. Ideal for password and confirm password.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
anotherTextView - The TextView whose contents have to be checked against the TextView that is being validated.
返回：
True if both the TextView contents are equal.
抛出：
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If anotherTextView is null.

eq

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> eq(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                               java.lang.String expectedString)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text value equals the given String value.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
expectedString - String value to be compared with the text returned by getText(). null is treated as empty String.
返回：
True if the text matches the {@code expectedString{@code value, false otherwise.

eq

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> eq(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                               java.lang.String expectedString,
                                               boolean ignoreCase,
                                               boolean trimInput)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text value equals the given String value.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
expectedString - String value to be compared with the text returned by getText(). null is treated as empty String.
ignoreCase - Specifies whether the text's case differences should be ignored.
trimInput - Specifies whether to trim the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the text matches the expectedString{@code value, false otherwise. The return value is affected by {@code ignoreCase} and {@code trimInput} parameters.

eq

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> eq(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                               int expectedInt)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text value equals the specified int value.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
expectedInt - int value to be compared with the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the input text is equal to the {@code expectedInt{@code value.

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> gt(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                               int lesserInt)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text value is greater than the specified int value.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
lesserInt - int value to be compared with the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the input text is greater to the {@code expectedInt{@code value.

public static Rule<android.widget.TextView> lt(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                               int greaterInt)
Checks if the TextView or its subclass View's displayed text value is less than the specified int value.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
greaterInt - int value to be compared with the text returned by getText().
返回：
True if the input text is less than the {@code expectedInt{@code value.

checked

public static Rule<android.widget.Checkable> checked(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                     boolean checked)
Checks if the Checkable or its subclass View's state is same as the state specified.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
checked - The expected state of the Checkable widget.
返回：
True if the state is same as checked.

spinnerEq

public static Rule<android.widget.Spinner> spinnerEq(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                     java.lang.String expectedString,
                                                     boolean ignoreCase,
                                                     boolean trimInput)
Checks if the Spinner's selected item's String value (obtained by calling toString() on the selected item) equals the expected String value.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
expectedString - String value to be compared with the text returned by calling toString() on the selected Spinner item.
ignoreCase - Specifies whether the text's case differences should be ignored.
trimInput - Specifies whether to trim the String returned by toString() on the selected item.
返回：
True if both the String values are equal.

spinnerEq

public static Rule<android.widget.Spinner> spinnerEq(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                     int expectedPosition)
Checks if the Spinner's selected item's position (obtained by calling getSelectionItemPosition()) equals the expected selection index.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
expectedPosition - The position to be compared with the position returned by calling getSelectedItemPosition() on the Spinner.
返回：
True if both the String values are equal.

and

public static Rule<android.view.View> and(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                          Rule<?>... rules)
Performs an '&&' (and) operation on the given array of Rules.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
rules - An array of Rules on which the '&&' (and) operation is to be performed.
返回：
True if all Rules are valid.

or

public static Rule<android.view.View> or(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                         Rule<?>... rules)
Performs a '||' (or) operation on the given array of Rules.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
rules - An array of Rules on which the '||' (or) operation is to be performed.
返回：
True if at least one of the Rules is valid.

compositeAnd

public static Rule<android.view.View> compositeAnd(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                   java.util.LinkedHashMap<android.view.View,Rule<?>> viewsAndRules)
Unlike the other rules, this one performs an '&&' (and) operation on several Views.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
viewsAndRules - A LinkedHashMap containing rules for different Views.
返回：
True if all Rules are valid.

compositeOr

public static Rule<android.view.View> compositeOr(java.lang.String failureMessage,
                                                  java.util.LinkedHashMap<android.view.View,Rule<?>> viewsAndRules)
Unlike the other rules, this one performs a '||' (or) operation on several Views.

参数：
failureMessage - The failure message for this Rule.
viewsAndRules - A LinkedHashMap containing rules for different Views.
返回：
True if at least one of the Rules is valid.
